item.title: Jerry add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The highest praise of God consists in the denial of him by the atheist who finds creation so perfect that it can dispense with a creator." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Louis-Ferdinand Celine
item.description: "You can lose your way groping among the shadows of the past." -- Louis-Ferdinand Celine

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "His nature was really like a sheet of paper that has been folded so often in every direction that it is impossible to straighten it out." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The inertia of the mind urges it to slide down the easy slope of imagination, rather than to climb the steep slope of introspection." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "Our slightest desire, though unique as a chord, nevertheless includes the fundamental notes on which the whole of our life is built. And sometimes, if we were to eliminate one of them, even one that we do not hear, that we are not aware of, one that has no connexion with the object of our quest, we would nevertheless see our whole desire for that object disappear." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "For neither our greatest fears nor our greatest hopes are beyond the limits of our strength--we are able in the end both to dominate the first and to achieve the second." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "And so they grow richer and richer, and the more they think of making a fortune the less they think of virtue; for when riches and virtue are placed together in the scales of the balance, the one always rises as the other falls." -- Socrates

item.title: Jerry add a quote by Bruce Trigger
item.description: "The ability to expend energy, especially in the form of other people's labour, in non-utilitarian ways, is the most basic and universally understood symbol of power." -- Bruce Trigger
